item.title: Ranks, Tensors and Abelian Groups
item.description: $\require{AMScd}$ Abelian Groups Given $a\in A$, the homomirphism $i_ a \from \ZZ \to A$ defined by $i_ a(k) = ka$ is mono (injective) iff $a$ has infinite order. Of $S$ is a set, the **free** Abelian group generated by $S$ is $$ \ZZ[S] = \ZZ S = \bigoplus_ {s \in S} \ZZ, $$ and it is the group of all finite linear combinations (with integer coefficients) of elements in $S$. The elements of $S$ are a **basis** (**base**) of $\ZZ[S]$.
